newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African industrials end weak on Wall St, futures.
newsitem.headline: S.African industrials end weak on Wall St, futures.

text.p: South African shares reversed early morning gains to end lower on the back of a weak Wall Street opening and as local futures players unwound positions ahead of the September 16 close-out.
Golds were firmer on a better bullion price.
A follow-through of Monday's futures linked buying initially buoyed industrial shares, before nervousness on the Iraq crisis crept in sending industrials sliding, dealers said.
Dealers said that for a large part of the day, industrials tracked weakness on world markets which were knocked lower by news that the U.S. launched a cruise missile attack on Iraq in the morning.
They said equity prices were also subject to manipulation ahead of the futures close-out on September 16.
The market's direction on Wednesday would be determined by Wall Street's movement overnight, dealers said.
The overall index lost 29.9 points to 6,705.1, the industrial index shed 52.9 points to 7,858.9 and the gold index added 6.5 points to 1,806.4.
